title: I‘m really good at writing songs but I’m also really bad at singing. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think it all depends on your goals. What is important for you in music and what drives to become better at it - as simple as it may sound. As anonymous guy pointed out below: some great artists are not particularly great singers but some are great composers or writers. If you’re into classical music, one of Finnish music’s golden eras all time greats: Sibelius, wasn’t a good singer, and he by his own words sounded horrible. He still knew how to write emotional, harmonic, complex pieces of music. Also I think every human being can learn to sing. Of course naturally some voices might have more depth in them. It still doesn’t mean you shouldn’t take care and give credit for your unique own voice. I’m a singer myself but I don’t know much about writing songs or lyrics. More importantly I need more musical theory to be able to do that effectively.
